<line: 32> O R D E R

[TEXT]
<line: 34> NOW, this 23  day of September, 2016, upon
<line: 35> rd

[TEXT]
<line: 37> consideration of the following documents:

[TEXT]
<line: 39> (1)
<line: 40> Decision of Administrative Law Judge Anne W.
<line: 41> Chain dated December 28, 2012 and filed as
<line: 42> Exhibit A to plaintiff’s Complaint on    
<line: 43> July 31, 2014;
<line: 44> (2)
<line: 45> Complaint, which complaint is undated and was
<line: 46> filed July 31, 2014;
<line: 47> (3)
<line: 48> Answer, which answer is undated and was filed
<line: 49> October 10, 2014;
<line: 50> (4)
<line: 51> Plaintiff’s Brief and Statement of Issues in
<line: 52> Support of Request for Review, which brief
<line: 53> and statement of issues is undated and was
<line: 54> filed November 13, 2014;
<line: 55> (5)  Defendant’s Response to Request for Review of
<line: 56> Plaintiff, which response is undated and was
<line: 57> filed May 13, 2014;
<line: 58> (6)
<line: 59> Plaintiff’s Reply Brief, which reply brief is
<line: 60> undated and was filed December 12, 2014

[TITLE]
<line: 2> Case 2:14-cv-03242-JKG   Document 15   Filed 09/26/16   Page 2 of 3

[TEXT]
<line: 4> (7)
<line: 5> Report and Recommendation of United States
<line: 6> Magistrate Judge Elizabeth T. Hey dated and
<line: 7> filed May 12, 2016;

[TEXT]
<line: 9> after a thorough review of the record in this matter; it
<line: 10> appearing that neither party filed objections to Magistrate Judge
<line: 11> Hey’s Report and Recommendation; it further appearing that
<line: 12> Magistrate Judge Hey’s Report and Recommendation correctly
<line: 13> determined the legal and factual issues presented in this case,
<line: 14> IT IS ORDERED that Magistrate Judge Hey’s Report and
<line: 15> Recommendation is approved and adopted.

[TEXT]
<line: 17> IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that plaintiff’s request for
<line: 18> review is granted to the extent that the matter is remanded for
<line: 19> further proceedings consistent with this adjudication.

[TEXT]
<line: 21> IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that judgment is entered in favor
<line: 22> of plaintiff John Vega, and against defendant Carolyn W. Colvin,
<line: 23> Acting Commissioner of the Social Security Administration.

[TEXT]
<line: 25> IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the decision of the
<line: 26> Commissioner dated December 28, 2012 and affirmed by the Appeals
<line: 27> Council on April 25, 2014 which denied benefits to plaintiff John
<line: 28> Vega is reversed.

[TEXT]
<line: 30> IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that pursuant to sentence four of
<line: 31> 42 U.S.C. § 405(g) this matter is remanded to the Commissioner 
<line: 32> for further proceedings in accordance with Magistrate Judge Hey’s
<line: 33> Report and Recommendation.

[ABANDON]
<line: 35> -2-

[TITLE]
<line: 2> Case 2:14-cv-03242-JKG   Document 15   Filed 09/26/16   Page 3 of 3

[TEXT]
<line: 4> IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Clerk of Court shall
<line: 5> close this case for statistical purposes.

<line: 7> BY THE COURT:
